verses.text: Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus , (this \add is\add* Ahasuerus which reigned , from India even unto Ethiopia , \add over\add* an hundred and seven and twenty provinces :)
\add That\add* in those days , when the king Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom , which \add was\add* in Shushan the palace ,
In the third year of his reign , he made a feast unto all his princes and his servants ; the power of Persia and Media , the nobles and princes of the provinces , \add being\add* before him:
When he shewed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honour of his excellent majesty many days , \add even\add* an hundred and fourscore days.

And when these days were expired , the king made a feast unto all the people that were present in Shushan the palace , both unto great and small , seven days , in the court of the garden of the king’s palace ;\f + \fr 1.5 \ft present: Heb. found\f*

\add Where were\add* white , green , and blue , \add hangings\add*, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble : the beds \add were of\add* gold and silver , upon a pavement of red , and blue , and white , and black , marble.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft blue, hangings: or, violet, etc\f*\f + \fr 1.6 \ft of red…: or, of porphyre, and marble and alabaster, and stone of blue colour\f*

And they gave \add them\add* drink in vessels of gold , (the vessels being diverse one from another ,) and royal wine in abundance , according to the state of the king.\f + \fr 1.7 \ft royal…: Heb. wine of the kingdom\f*\f + \fr 1.7 \ft state: Heb. hand\f*
And the drinking \add was\add* according to the law ; none did compel : for so the king had appointed to all the officers of his house , that they should do according to every man’s pleasure.
Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women \add in\add* the royal house which \add belonged\add* to king Ahasuerus. \p

¶ On the seventh day , when the heart of the king was merry with wine , he commanded Mehuman , Biztha , Harbona , Bigtha , and Abagtha , Zethar , and Carcas , the seven chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king ,\f + \fr 1.10 \ft chamberlains: or, eunuchs\f*

To bring Vashti the queen before the king with the crown royal , to shew the people and the princes her beauty : for she \add was\add* fair to look on.\f + \fr 1.11 \ft fair…: Heb. good of countenance\f*

But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king’s commandment by \add his\add* chamberlains : therefore was the king very wroth , and his anger burned in him.\f + \fr 1.12 \ft by his…: Heb. which was by the hand of his eunuchs\f* \p
¶ Then the king said to the wise men , which knew the times , (for so \add was\add* the king’s manner toward all that knew law and judgment :

And the next unto him \add was\add* Carshena , Shethar , Admatha , Tarshish , Meres , Marsena , \add and\add* Memucan , the seven princes of Persia and Media , which saw the king’s face , \add and\add* which sat the first in the kingdom ;)
What shall we do unto the queen Vashti according to law , because she hath not performed the commandment of the king Ahasuerus by the chamberlains ?\f + \fr 1.15 \ft What…: Heb. What to do\f*

And Memucan answered before the king and the princes , Vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king only, but also to all the princes , and to all the people that \add are\add* in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus.

For \add this\add* deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all women , so that they shall despise their husbands in their eyes , when it shall be reported , The king Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she came not.

\add Likewise\add* shall the ladies of Persia and Media say this day unto all the king’s princes , which have heard of the deed of the queen. Thus \add shall there arise\add* too much contempt and wrath.

If it please the king , let there go a royal commandment from him , and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes , that it be not altered , That Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus ; and let the king give her royal estate unto another that is better than she.\f + \fr 1.19 \ft If it…: Heb. If it be good with the king\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft unto…: Heb. unto her companion\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft from him: Heb. from before him\f*\f + \fr 1.19 \ft be not…: Heb. pass not away\f*
And when the king’s decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his empire , (for it is great ,) all the wives shall give to their husbands honour , both to great and small.
And the saying pleased the king and the princes ; and the king did according to the word of Memucan :\f + \fr 1.21 \ft pleased…: Heb. was good in the eyes of the king\f*

For he sent letters into all the king’s provinces , into every province according to the writing thereof, and to every people after their language , that every man should bear rule in his own house , and that \add it\add* should be published according to the language of every people.\f + \fr 1.22 \ft that it…: Heb. that one should publish it according to the language of his people\f*
